#Text=Toby Foyeh
#Text=Toby Foyeh
#Text=( a. k. a. Tokunbo Olowofoyeku ) is a British , Nigerian American musician and guitarist .
#Text=He was born in London , England of Nigerian parents and is currently based in the Washington , D.C. area of the USA .

#Text=Although essentially a self-taught musician , he studied music at Berklee College of Music , Boston , Massachusetts and Howard University , Washington DC [ 1 ] where he also earned a degree in Film Directing .
#Text=He has performed extensively on Nigerian Television and his music videos have been played for many years . [ 2 ]
#Text=With his band , Orchestra Africa , he has performed in the United Kingdom , Europe , United States , Canada , Japan and Africa . [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 2 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=He has had three previous CD/Album releases which include ' Here I Come ' in Nigeria , ‘ Jalolo ’ 1999/2001 and Lagos Ilu Eko 2006 released in the USA , Canada and Europe .
#Text=The Album ‘ Here I Come ' produced the singles ' Ore mi ’ and ‘ I 'm on Fire ’ .
#Text=Jalolo and Rain Dance are key tracks from the other two CDs .
#Text=His most recent CD ‘ Pirates of Africa ’ is scheduled for release in 2019 . [ 6 ]
#Text=Early life
#Text=Toby was born in London , England , grew up mainly in Western Nigeria before progressing to embark on university education at Berklee College of Music and Howard University in the USA .
#Text=He is the fifth child of Chief Babatunji Olowofoyeku , a Nigerian politician and the former Attorney General of the Western Region in Nigeria 's First Republic ( 1960-1966 ) .
#Text=He has 14 brothers and two sisters who live variously in the USA , the UK and Nigeria .

#Text=From the age of 5 , he attended Children 's Home School , Ibadan and then transferred to Abadina School ( University of Ibadan ) and finished his primary education at St Johns School , Iloro , Ilesha . [ 7 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=Education
#Text=From St Johns School , Iloro , Ilesha , Foyeh was admitted to King 's College , Lagos , Nigeria .
#Text=He then attended International School Ibadan , Nigeria .
#Text=On completion of high school education , he relocated to the USA and attended Berklee College of Music , Boston , Massachusetts and Howard University , Washington DC . [ 1 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Foyeh started playing music at an early age in Nigeria , with school bands at King 's College , Lagos and International School Ibadan , as well as while studying in the United States .

#Text=According to Nigerian custom and parental expectation , he was supposed to have become an engineer , a doctor or enter into the legal profession in the footsteps of his father , Chief Babatunji Olowofoyeku .
#Text=Instead he chose music .
#Text=Foyeh was interested in modernising Nigerian and African music , and he sought to create a flux and synthesis between the two .
#Text=A band he formed with some high school friends went on to tour America as Hugh Masekela 's Ojah Band . [ 7 ]
#Text=He has produced , recorded and co-produced other artists with varying musical styles including African , Jazz and Soul .

#Text=One such project with keyboard player Roy Carter ( ex- Heatwave ( band ) ) produced a dance hit for UK group Covergirl , while other musical collaborations include projects with Jake Sollo ( ex- Osibisa ) , Saul Malinga ( Ipi Tombi South African Music and Dance Troupe ) and Orlando Julius Ekemode . [ 6 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=One of his younger brothers is Professor Abimbola Olowofoyeku , a professor of Law at Brunel University London , England . [ 8 ]
#Text=He has published articles and academic texts for students and practitioners on tax law , revenue law and judicial immunity . [ 9 ] [ 10 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Foyeh ’s youngest sister is Hollywood actress , Folake Olowofoyeku , who has acted in TV programmes like Law & Order , Modern Family and alongside Thandi Newton in sci-fi series Westworld .
#Text=In movies , she has acted in The Beaver alongside Mel Gibson and in Death Race 2050 with Malcolm McDowell . [ 12 ] [ 13 ]

#Text=Folake is currently ( 2019 ) shooting a new Chuck Lorre ( Producer of The Big Bang Theory ) TV comedy series Bob Hearts Abishola in which she plays a nurse who is the love interest of the lead character , Billy Gardell . [ 14 ] [ 15 ]
#Text=Foyeh ’s nephew , Kwame Jackson , was the runner up in The Apprentice which was hosted on NBC in 2004 by Donald Trump .
#Text=Kwame , is a New York City based entrepreneur .
#Text=His accolades include having been given the keys to several cities such as Detroit , Indianapolis , Trenton and Columbia .
#Text=There was also the declaration of ’ Kwame Jackson Day ’ by the Mayor of Charlotte , NC , Kwame 's hometown . [ 16 ] [ 17 ]
#Text=Musical style and influences
#Text=Foyeh ’s early influences from West Africa include Haruna Ishola , Victor Uwaifo and Fela Kuti .
#Text=His influences from the USA include the likes of Miles Davis , Jimi Hendrix , Carlos Santana and George Benson .
#Text=The music genres and styles that feature is his music are Yoruba Traditional , Africa Jam , Afro Beat , Highlife , Pop , Rock , Funk and Jazz . [ 18 ] [ 2 ] [ 5 ] [ 1 ]
#Text=Awards and achievements
#Text=Scholarship award for the BA ( final year ) Howard University , Washington DC , USA .
#Text=Scholarship award for two years at International School Ibadan , Nigeria . [ 2 ] [ 1 ] [ 7 ]
#Text=Discography
#Text=Toby has released a range of CDs , 12-inch vinyl singles and albums over a period of almost forty years . [ 6 ]
#Text=Here I Come ( 1981 )
#Text=Danger Zone ( with Andy Sodjka ) ( 1984 )
#Text=I 'm a winner ( Covergirl ) ( 1985 )
#Text=Stay With Me ( Covergirl ) ( 1986 )
#Text=Hollywood City ( 1986 )
#Text=Jalolo ( UK ) ( 1991 )
#Text=Jalolo ( USA ) ( 1999 )
#Text=Ilu Eko ( Lagos ) ( 2006 )
#Text=Ore Mi ( 2017 )
#Text=Pirates of Africa ( 2019 )
#Text=Labels : Taretone Records , Space Station Records , Kameleon and Kameleon Africa Records , Toby Foyeh Soundwave Records
#Text=Tours

#Text=Toby Foyeh and Orchestra Africa have performed at many US Universities as well as Performing Arts Centers including Kennedy Center and Cerritos Center , Cerritos CA . [ 19 ] [ 20 ] Choreographer , singer and dancer , Becky Umeh , was one of those in Orchestra Africa for some time who toured North Carolina , South Carolina and New York ( Syracuse Festival ) with Toby in 2005 .
#Text=The band has been on tour internationally and performed in many International Jazz Festivals such as Malta Jazz Festival , Toronto Jazz Festival ( thrice ) , [ 21 ]
#Text=Montreal International Jazz Festival

#Text=, Vancouver Jazz Festival , Calgary Jazz Festival , Medicine Hat Jazz Festival , Detroit Jazz Festival , Syracuse Jazz Festival , Washington DC Jazz Festival , Bahamas Jazz Festival , Jamaica Ocho Rios Jazz Festival , Grenada Spice Jazz Festival , Curacao Jazz Festival and Fuji Rock Festival , Nigaata , Japan [ 4 ]
#Text=There have also been tours and performances in Nigeria , [ 2 ] and London , England . [ 5 ]
